author: Photos and story by Jose Huerta, Press Dispatch
title: A Unique Look At Cuba
text: A Unique Look At Cuba Comment By Photos and story by Jose Huerta, Press Dispatch VVdailypress.com By Photos and story by Jose Huerta, Press Dispatch Posted Jul. 25, 2015 at 8:24 PM By Photos and story by Jose Huerta, Press Dispatch Posted Jul. 25, 2015 at 8:24 PM » Social News Why visit Cuba? Most travelers will tell you it’s because they want to see Cuba before it changes forever. I think they’re right, and big changes have already begun. Some people believe the embargo would never be lifted in their lifetime, but after more than 50 years the United States embassy in Havana has reopened, and negotiations with the Cuban government on normalizing relations are ongoing. So what is Cuba like now? Unlike many other countries, Cuba attains a unique trait, an old world charm that makes you feel as if you have traveled back in time. As an American, I was privileged with the opportunity to visit Cuba, and as a photographer I was given the unique opportunity to photograph a city vibrant with color, surrounded in texture and decay, but warm with the smiling faces of the Cuban people.
